front.title: The WWW Common Gateway Interface: Version 1.2

abstract.t: The Common Gateway Interface (CGI) is a simple interface for runningexternal programs, software or gateways under an information server ina platform-independent manner. Currently, the supported informationservers are HTTP servers.The interface has been in use by the World-Wide Web since 1993. Thisspecification defines the interface known as 'CGI/1.2', which is anextension of the 'CGI/1.1' interface developed and documented at theU.S. National Centre for Supercomputing Applications [NCSA-CGI]. Thisdocument also defines the use of the CGI/1.2 interface on the Unix(R)and AmigaDOS(tm) systems.
